text.value: Henry famously married six times for a variety of different reasons but underlying them was his desire for a son to continue the Tudor dynasty established by his father in 1485. Jane Seymour was the only one of Henryâ€™s queen to bear him a male heir, the future Edward VI, in 1537 (Jane would die of complications from the birth shortly afterwards). If you look carefully at Jane, you can see how she conforms to the ideals expected from an English queen. On the left are a number of attributes; on the right indicators. Match the two together by linking attribute to indicator.
